Can you forge Alice's signature? She used RSA low-exponent encryption to sign a message, but her public key and this signature remain: 0x6b31e26a506851fa8d2d667eedf63164313f7f53e3fe7066dbcc88c9c005586b1484c98a8a174cf48ab997827d0a763029b473fea555ad2d380a753f5c097dff

Public Key (n, e): (7964679104848265711152316052322761549434707620416922284675104900051078247577992968577234118194256470514362927556570013959052139469858507964504730572712431, 3)

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{xjkfx1gy}
ciphertext: 0x6b31e26a506851fa8d2d667eedf63164313f7f53e3fe7066dbcc88c9c005586b1484c98a8a174cf48ab997827d0a763029b473fea555ad2d380a753f5c097dff
cipher: RSA Low-Exponent Signature
hint: What happens when you cube small numbers? Remember e=3!
necessary_info: Public Key (n, e): (7964679104848265711152316052322761549434707620416922284675104900051078247577992968577234118194256470514362927556570013959052139469858507964504730572712431, 3)
subtype: rsa_sign_with_low_public_exponent
archetype: signature_schemes
